content.value: BTO successfully hosted a meet and greet at the University of Toronto Scarborough for students to introduce BTO to the community. First of all, thank you to all those students that were able to take the time to come! It was amazing to see and meet all of you. The agenda of the session was to inform students about how they could contribute to BTO, including how they could become a member, apply for more senior positions, donate to the cause, and become a volunteer at future events.
It also wouldn't be a Blankets for T.O. meeting if we did not show off our blankets! In case you missed it, here it was:
Blankets for T.O. is looking forward to working with the community! For those who were not able to attend, do not worry, we will have plenty of updates through our social media and website!

childMarkdownRemark.html: BTO hosted a meet and greet at the University of Toronto Scarborough for students to introduce BTO to the community.
childMarkdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: BTO hosted a meet and greet at the University of Toronto Scarborough for students to introduce BTO to the community.

node.title: Care Packages complete, MP Shaun Chen honours Blankets for T.O.

childMarkdownRemark.html: During the Blankets for T.O. Care Package Event we gathered essential items to create personalized Care Package bags and donated them to local shelters. We also received a visit and a certificate from Member of Parliament Shaun Chen!

node.title: Water.org UTSC x BTO Winter/Holiday Event

childMarkdownRemark.html: We collaborate with Water.org UTSC to provide students with opportunities to socialize with friends, win prizes in games and raffles, and become better informed about homelessness in Toronto and water scarcity around the world.
In November 2020, still amid the COVID-19 Pandemic, BTO engaged in a donut distribution initiative while also helping to promote a local small business on campus.
